Modern foliation in pencil using western numerals (faulty).|Decoration: Illuminated title page executed ingold and colors on fol. 2a (colors faded; upper portion of leaf wanting).|Inscription in Roman script on a label pasted on the pastedown of the upper cover: "A252". (fol. 121b). The ms. appears however to date to a later period, probably the 15th century. Collation statement on the margin of the colophon, mentioning a samāʻ note dated 736 H. written on the exemplar.|Two ownership statements on fol. 1a, in the name of Badr al-Dīn al-Manāshīrī al-Shāfiʻī and of Aḥmad ibn Badr al-Dīn, the latter with impression of a seal. Several inscriptions on fol. 1a, including verses of poetry and ownership statements. Reading statements refering to Muḥammad ibn al-Naṣībī al-Shāfiʻī throughout (see fol. 10b, 16a, margin). Kabīkaj on fol. 184b.|Collation: Paper, fol. 184 ; 1-1810 194 ; catchword on the verso of each leaf ; the quires are numbered using Arabic ordinals in the form "al-Thānī".|Several ownership statements, one in the name of Ibrāhīm al-Naṣībī on fol. 1a; one in the name of Abū al-Ṭayyib al-Ḥusayn ibn al-Shiḥnah al-Shāfiʻī, dated Rajab 878 H. [1473] on fol. 2a, with others erased. Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.

subject_as_recorded: Islamic law--Early works to 1800
note: Copied A.H. 756 [A.D. 1355] by Muḥammad ibn Sālim...ibn Amīr ʻAlī al-ḥaddād.|Fols. 172; 24.4 x 17.2 cm.; written surface 21.5 x 14 cm.; 31 lines to page; on glazed Arabic paper; in naskhi; entries in red.|A commentary on a work on jurisprudence.|Beg.: بسم الله ... لواطف الاىمان تتوقف على القدرة علىها|Colophon: تم بحمد الله وحسن توفىقه وصلى الله على سىدنا محمد واله اجمعىن في عشرة ربىع الاول ستة وخمسىن وسبعمائة من ىدالعبد الضعىف الفقىرالحقىرالمفتقرالى رحمة ربه الوهاب الغفار محمد بن سالم ... بن امىرعلي الحداد غفرالله له ولوالدىه ولجمىع المسلمىن والمسلمات والمؤمنىن والمؤمنات وصلى الله على سىدنا محمد واله اجمعىن|Marginal notes and glosses. MS in good condition; Arabic binding with flap.|Acquired from Bārūdī, Beirūt, A D. 1925.

subject_as_recorded: Islamic education--Early works to 1800|Learning--Early works to 1800|Prayer--Islam--Early works to 1800|Worship (Islam)--Early works to 1800|Islam--Rituals--Early works to 1800|Islam--Customs and practices--Early works to 1800|Islamic law--Sources|Fatwas--Early works to 1800|Advisory opinions (Islamic law)--Early works to 1800|Manuscripts, Arabic--New Jersey--Princeton
physical_description: Extent: 116 leaves : paper ; 203 x 145 (131 x 84) mm. bound to 206 x 154 mm.
note: Ms. composite codex.|Title from fol. 1a.|Copying of texts 1 and 2 was completed on a Thursday in the last 10 days of Rabīʻ al-Awwal 1068 in the town of Sivas -- colophon text 2 (fol. 92b).|Texts 1 and 2 written in medium small and text 3 in small naskh in black ink with use of red. Texts one and two have 15, and text 3, 21 lines per page. Written area is slightly larger in text 3. Catchwords present in all texts. Foliation in Arabic numerals in black ink and in Western numerals in pencil starts on fol. 2. Glazed European paper. Ff. 93a-94b (between texts 2 and 3) have several fetvas in the first scribe's hand the first of which is signed Ebussuud Efendi. Fol. 95a is blank. Fl. 95b-96a have table of contents for text 2, dated 1142 (1729 or 30). Fol. 1a has a note on endowment pasted onto the paper, accompanied by a seal, stating that the ms. was endowed by the Kadi of Erzurum, Seyyid Abdullah Edip, known as Cennetʹzade, to the library attached to the 'Dār al-ʻUlamāʼ' in Erzurum, on the condition that it does not leave this library. The same fol. has a circular seal with the figure of goat in purple ink. Fol. 92b (end of text 2) has several ownership statements, none dated.|Originally acquired by Robert Garrett from Abraham Shalom Yahuda ; 1942.

author_as_recorded: Ṭūsī, Muḥammad ibn al-Ḥasan, 995-1067?
author_as_recorded_agr: طوسي، محمد بن الحسن
physical_description: Extent: 331 leaves: paper ; 239 x 168 (182 x 114) mm. bound to 246 x 185 mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title from title page (later addition, fol. 1a).|17 lines per page. Written in medium large naskh in black ink with use of red for headings, re-inking and punctuation. Light cream glazed paper. Collation notes. Incomplete at the beginning (the Arabic foliation on the first original extant leaf reads "6"). According to the foliation using Arabic numerals and the catchwords, some leaves are missing (see between fol. 134 and fol. 136, between fol. 137 and 138). Entire quires seem also to be missing (see mention "al-sādis" on fol. 36a and "al-ʻāshir" on fol. 47a). Some leaves are damaged or repaired (see fol. 134-135, 142), sometimes with the original text re-written on the repair (see fol. 153-154). Some leaves are later replacements (see fol. 200-203). Catchword on the verso of each leaf. The quires are numbered using Arabic ordinals (in the form " al-sādis", see fol. 36a). Foliation in red ink using Arabic numerals. Foliation in pencil using Western numerals. Stamp from the library of Majd al-Dīn (no. 1275, see fol. 2a). Seal on fol. 331a.|Stamp from the library of Majd al-Dīn (no. 1275, see fol. 2a). Seal on fol. 331a. Stamp and inscriptions on fol. 331b. Stamp on fol. 1a with inscription "132" in Arabic script written in pencil above it (repeated on fol. 331b). Label with the inscription "36" in Arabic numerals pasted on upper cover.|Copied by al-Ḥusayn ibn Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī ibn Abī al-ʻAlā ibn Tamām ibn Mahdī al-ʻAskarī in the last decade of Ṣafar 645.|From the Kitābkhānah-i Majd al-Dīn, no.1275. Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.

physical_description: Extent: 378 leaves : paper ; 305 x 210 (220 x 120) mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Physical description: 31 lines per page; written in naskhi in black on cream European glazed, laid paper. Original text in red; catchwords; extensive marginal and interlinear notes and glosses. Entries in large script. Text on fol. 1b framed in black; on fol. 80a-377a framed in red. Legal topic discussed in the text written on recto of each leaf (beginning on fol. 2a) in upper left corner. Numerous inserts containing notes and glosses. Outer edges of first and last few leaves worn with some loss of marginalia.|Origin: Copy completed 2 Rabīʻ I 1080 H. [5 March 1650].|Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.

The lower corner is open, and shows an inscription on the covered recto. Fol. 318 consists of a leaf pasted on the verso of an original leaf. The paper and script suggest a dating of about the 15th century.|From the books of Imām Shamīl ("al-Imām Shamwīl"), who bought it from Mahdī al-Shālī al-Shāfiʻī (inscriptions on fol. 1a). note: Ms. codex.|Title from preamble (fol. 2a, l. 5).|27 lines per page. Written in medium large taʻlīq in black ink with use of red for overlining and the word "qawluh". From fol. 269 on, hole in the upper central part of the leaves, with important loss of text (repaired with European paper).|Collation: Paper, fol. 297 ; 1-2910 308 (-1 at the end of the quire) ; catchword on the verso of each leaf ; the quires are numbered using Arabic numerals, mentioning the quire number and the part number (see fol. 31a ; cut off on most quires due to trimming of the pages). Note the 51 for 15, 91 for 19, etc.|Inscription in Arabic script in red pencil on the pastedown of upper cover: "77 Irbīl(?)".|Origin: Copy completed by [---] ibn ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad al-shahīr bi-Ibn [---], on 4 Ṣafar 864 [Nov. 11, 1459] (colophon, fol. 293a, partly wanting due to the hole mentioned in the physical description).|Three ownership statements on fol. 1a, one obliterated, one in the name of Muḥammad ibn al-Kāshif, one written on an erased inscription, in the name of al-Ḥājj ʻAbd al-Karīm, dated 1214 H. [1799 or 1800]. Two ownership statements on fol. 293a, in the name of Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad (or Najīb?) al-Kātib, dated R[ajab, or Rabīʻ al-Thānī] 864 [1460], and of Shams al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn al-Makārī (Hakārī?) al-Shāfiʻī (partly erased). Erased waqf inscription on some leaves (see fol. 20a, upper margin). Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.

Written in small naskh in black ink with use of red for headines. Thin paper with regular laid lines and some chain lines visible. From fol. 333 on, European(?) glazed paper. Fol. 1-9 are later additions on European glazed paper with watermark. Table of contents on fol. 1a. More detailed table of contents on fol. 5b-9b. Title on tail of text block (hardly legible). Inscription in Arabic numerals on a label pasted on the upper cover: "235". Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on the pastedown of the upper cover: "Ḥāʼ 520".|Copy completed in 916 H. by Yūsuf ibn Muḥammad (colophon, fol. 331b). (ownership statement with seal, fol. 10a). Bought from Aḥmad Ḥalabī, known as Ṭabībī al-Minḥālijī(?) by Maḥmūd, known as ---? (fol. 10a). From the books of ʻUmar Luṭfī ibn Muḥammad al-Badrūnī (ownership statement, fol. 1a) ; probably the same as ʻUmar Luṭfī, mudarris in Ghalaṭah, mentioned in an ownership statement, fol. 3a. Bought from al-shaykh Kāmīl by ʻAbd Allāh ibn Muḥammad, known as Ibn al-Shaykh Aʻ--? al-Ṣabbāgh, Aleppo, Shaʻbān 1, 1274 [March 17, 1858], witnessed by Shaykh Sharīf, teacher (muʼaddib al-aṭfāl), and Shaykh ʻAbd al-Raḥmān, shaykh ---? (inscription, fol. 2a). Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.

Qurʼanic verses mentioning "Shifāʼ" on fol. 188a. Fol. 190 blank. Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on the upper cover: "11". subject_as_recorded: Ibn Qudāmah, Muwaffaq al-Dīn ʻAbd Allāh ibn Aḥmad, 1147-1223. Muqniʻ|Mardāwī, ʻAlī ibn Sulaymān, 1414 or 1415-1480 or 1481. Tanqīḥ al-mushbiʻ fī taḥrīr aḥkām al-Muqniʻ|Islamic law--History--16th century--Sources|Hanbalites--Early works to 1800|Manuscripts, Arabic--New Jersey--Princeton
author_as_recorded: Ibn al-Najjār, Taqī al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad, 1492 or 1493-1564 or 1565
author_as_recorded_agr: ابن النجار، تقي الدين محمد بن احمد
physical_description: Extent: 236 leaves: paper ; 218 x 160 (161 x 97) mm. bound to 220 x 170 mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title from title page (fol. 1a). The words "maʻa al-Tanqīḥ wa-ziyādāt " are added between the lines.|Physical description: 27 lines per page. Written in medium small naskh in black ink with use of red dor headings ; yāʼ for alif maqṣūrah ; final yāʼ dotted. European paper of at least two types, some with watermark (Tre Lune, see fol. 115-116) ; frame-ruled. Collation notes and occasional annotation on the margin. Several inscriptions on fol. 1a, including ownership statements, a fāʼidah indicating the number of letters in the Fātiḥah, a ḥadīth ; inscriptions on fol. 233b, including sayings attributed to al-Imām al-Shāfiʻī. The lower part of fol. 1 has been reinforced by a piece of paper with inscription pasted on the recto. Inscription on the pastedowns. Foliation in black ink using Arabic numerals. Modern foliation in pencil using Western numerals (with two fol. 181 and a leaf left blank between fol. 181bis and 182)). Upper part of fol. 2 wanting with loss of text ; loose leaves.|Collation: Paper, fol. 236 ; 1-1710 1810 (two central bifolios juxtaposed) 19-2310 244 (+2, fol. 230 -231 in moden foliation) ; catchword on the verso of each leaf.|Origin: According to colophon, copied by Muṣṭafá Ibn Muḥammad al-Ḍamīrī al-Ḥanbalī, and completed on Monday 11 ("12 khalat") Ṣafar 1134 [Dec. 1, 1721] (fol. 233a).|Ownership statements in the name of al-Ḥājj Muḥammad Amīn, known as al-Shaṭṭī al-Ḥanbalī ... al-Baghdādī (dated 1177 H.) and of ʻAbd al-Raḥmān Ibn ʻAbd Allāh al-Ḥanbalī ...? Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.

note: Ms. codex.|Title from fol. 1b.|Copied by Yaḥyá ibn Mullā Bakr ibn Mullā Ibrāhīm and completed on the 25th of Rajab 1214 (1799) -- colophon (fol. 172b).|17 lines per page. Written in a medium sized informal naskh in black ink with use of red. Catchwords on the verso of each leaf. Glazed European paper. Foliation in pancil in Western numerals. Date 1218 (1803 or 4) follows the colophon on fol. 172b, probably refering to the date of the last three fol. (fol. 170-172) which are in a similar hand but on different paper and thus supplied later. Fol. 173a has a record of birth dated 16th of Rajab 1222 (1807).|Acquired by Robert Garrett from Brill, Leyden, 1904.

subject_as_recorded: Islamic law--Early works to 1800
note: Anonymous.|Fols. 138; 21 x 15.2 cm.; written surface 14-15.5 x 8.5 cm.; 21 lines to page; on glazed European paper; in Fārisi; with catchwords; entries in red on last 39 folios.|A fragment of an Alfīyah (an ode of a thousand verses) and its commentary on jurisprudence. It is probably the Alfīyah of Abū al-Walīd Muḥammad Ibn al-Shiḥnah, A.H. 815 [A.D. 1412/3]. See ḥājjī Khalīfah, Kashf al-ẓunūn (1835-58), I, p. 419.|Beg.: بالتمکن وان لم ىصرح بالرضى ... ولا ردان ...|Ending: ... بامکانه الفسخ بعد الروىة فىسقط بالتمکن|Marginal notes and summaries. Text in red on the last 39 folios. Incomplete at beginning and end. The first 99 folios are on different paper. MS in fair condition; Arabic binding. Probably from XVIIIth century.|Acquired from Bārūdī, Beirūt, A.D. 1925.

title_as_recorded: Sharḥ Risālah fī al-mashrūʻāt wa-ghayr al-mashrūʻāt
subject_as_recorded: Kaydānī. Risālah fī al-mashrūʻāt wa-ghayr al-mashrūʻāt|Islamic law--Early works to 1800
note: Anonymous.|Fols. 65; 25.3 x 15 cm.; written surface 19 x 8 cm.; 24 lines to page; on glazed European paper; in Fārisi; with catchwords.|A commentary on Risālah fī al-mashrūʻāt wa-ghayr al-mashrūʻāt, a work of jurisprudence dealing with the permissible and the forbidden by Luṭf Allāh al-Nasafī, known as al-Fāḍil al-Kaydāni, flourished ca. A.H. 900 [A.D. 1494].|Beg.: بسم الله ... معنى التسمىة بالفارسىة على التحقىق|Colophon: تمت الرسالة الشرىفـ[ة] الجامعة لاکثر المسائل المهمة للانام بعون الملك العلام بمن روح الشرىف خضر السىد علىه السلام. على ىد الضعىف المحتاج محمد کرىم باغىستاني [؟] تم|A few marginal notes. On back of first page is a note by a later hand stating that the commentary is by al-Taftāzānī; this is probably Aḥmad ibn Yaḥyá al-Taftāzānī, A.H. 906 [A.D. 1500/1]. MS in good condition; Arabic leather binding; blind stamped. Probably from the XVIIIth century.|Acquired from Bārūdī, Beirūt, A.D. 1925.

subject_as_recorded: Abū al-Saʻūd Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad, 1492 or 1493-1574 or 1575|Muḥammad, Prophet, -632|Hibah|Gifts (Islamic law)--Early works to 1800|Islam--Miscellanea--Early works to 1800|Islamic law--Early works to 1800
note: Fols. 107; 20.4 x 14.5 cm.; written surface 13-16.5 x 6.5-9.5 cm.; 11-21 lines to page; on glazed European paper; in naskhi and Fārisi; with catchwords; entries in red.|A collection containing:|1. al-Farāʼid, a treatise on theology, jurisprudence, grammar and lexicography by Ibn Kamāl Pāshā, A.H. 940 [A.D. 1533]. See Catalogus codicum arabicorum Bibliothecae Academiae Lugduno-Batavae, 2068.|2. Radd al-Kardarī al-ḥanafī ʻalá al-Ghazzālī al-Shāfiʻī, a reply by Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad ibn ʻAbd al-Sattār al-ʻImādī al-Kardarī, A.H. 642 [A.D. 1244] to a passage in Kitāb al-Mankhūl fī al-uṣūl, a work on jurisprudence by al-Ghazzālī, A.H. 505 [A.D. 1111]. The copy was made in A.H. 1002 [A.D. 1593].|3. A quotation from Sharḥ ṣudūr al-īmān fī manāqib al-Imām al-aʻẓam Abū ḥanīfah al-Nuʻmān, a work on the life of Abū ḥanīfah, A.H. 150 [A.D. 767] by Muḥammad ibn Yūsuf al-Dimashqī al-Ṣāliḥī, d. after A.H. 939 [A.D. 1532]. The quotation deals with the reply of Ibn ḥajar al-Haythamī, A.H. 973 [A.D. 1565/6] to al-Kardarīʼs attack on al-Ghazzālī. See previous work.|4. A eulogy in praise of, and an elegy lamenting, al-ʻAllāmah Abū al-Suʻūd al-Muftī.|5. An essay entitled Ṣifat al-Nabī.|6. Notes by Muḥammad ibn Ibrāhīm ibn... al-ḥanafī on Kitāb al-Hibah, a work on the legal aspects of gifts.|Marginal notes. MS in fair condition; Arabic leather binding; gilt stamped. Probably from XVIth-XVIIth centuries.|Acquired from Brill, Leyden, A.D. 1904.

subject_as_recorded: Islam--Doctrines--Early works to 1800|Islamic law--Early works to 1800
note: Fols. 114; 17 x 12 cm.; written surface 11.5-15.5 x 9.5 cm.; 14-19 lines to page; on glazed European and Arabic paper; in naskhi; with catchwords; entries in red.|A collection containing:|1. Maqāṣid al-ṭālibīn wa-fawāʼid al-rāghibīn, a work on scholastic theology by Saʻd al-Dīn al-Taftāzānī, A.H. 792 [A.D. 1390]. Cf. ḥājjī Khalīfah, Kashf al-ẓunūn (1835-58), VI, p. 48. Copy probably from XVth century. Rare.|2. Fawāʼid al-rāghibīn fī aḥkām al-dīn, an anonymous work on jurisprudence and legal theory. Copy was made in A.H. 738 [A.D. 1338] by ʻAbd al-Kāfī ibn Muḥammad al-Imāmī. Work probably unique.|MS in fair condition; worm-eaten; Arabic binding with flap.|Acquired from Bārūdī, Beirūt, A.D. 1925.

note: ff. 105. 251 x 168; 183 x 115 mm. 25 lin. 697 H., Sulaymān ibn Abī Bakr.|An acephalous work similar in scope to al-Samarqandīʼs Mukhtalaf al-riwāyah; the method of arrangement agrees with that described by al-Samarqandī as being peculiar to the works of his predecessors - he says in the pref. of Mukhtalij al-riwāyah (ms. 3677, fol. 1b): وارسم لخلاف کل واحد من الاىمة بابا على ترتىب الذى رتبه بعض اساتذنا ... غىر انهم اوردوا الکتب کلها فى کل باب وانا اورد الابواب کلها فى کل کتاب|Accordingly, the present work assigns a bāb to each of the imāms, and subdivides each bāb according to the usual order of law books: Kitāb al-Ṣalāh. Kitāb al-Zakāh, etc.|9 kurrāsahs are missing at the beginning; on fol. 9a the end of bāb Muḥammad (i.e., al-Shaybānī) and the beginning of a new bāb: بان قول ابى حنىفة على خلاف قول ابى ىوسف|باب قول ابى ىوسف على خلاف قول محمد:(14a).|باب قول زفر مخالفا لقول اصحابنا:(39a).|Lacuna after fol. 50; the last bāb begins on fol. 94b: باب جوابات مالك بن انس|Explicit (fol. 105b): وبىننا وبىن الشافعي خلاف فى دخول المسجد الحرام وحجتنا والجواب عن التعلق بانصّ قد مرّ فى باب الشافعى رحمه الله تم الکتاب

Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on the pastedown of the upper cover: "857/2 ḥāʼ".|Copy completed in Harāt in Jumādá al-Thānī 859 [May-June 1455] (colophon, fol. 219a).|On fol. 1a: Seal reading "Muṣtafá Shawkat(?)" ; ownership statement in the name of al-Sayyid Aḥmad Nūrī, known as Nūḥādīʹzādah(?), with seal, reading "al-Sayyid Aḥmad Nūrī" ; erased statement dated 1226(?) H. Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.

physical_description: Extent: 121 leaves : paper ; 270 x 92 (215 x 55) mm. bound to 270 x 95 mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title from colophon of the first Rubʻ (fol. 34b).|Physical description: 23 lines per page. Written in medium small naskh in black ink with use of red ; red dots marking hemistich. The text is vocalized ; final yāʼ dotted. Soft paper, dark cream, with laid lines and a few chain lines visible ; frame-ruled. Several inscriptions on fol. 1b-2a and 121a-b, including ownership statements, prayers, and records of birth dates. Chiefly quaternions, numbered using Arabic numerals. Worm-eaten ; stained with water ; tail of text block damaged ; a few loose leaves.|Origin: According to colophons, copied from a copy made on a copy written by Muḥammad ibn Sulaymān al-Anṣārī, known as Khaṭīb Dāriyā, 768 H., and collated with Shams al-Dīn al-Ṭarābulusī (fol. 34b, 71a). The final colophon states that this copy was made on a copy made on a copy by Ibn al-Khayyāṭ, and that it was copied by ʻAbd Allāh ibn Muḥammad ibn ʻAbd Allāh ibn ʻUmar ibn Muḥammad al-Zakī al-ʻIzzī in Jumādá II 862 [April-May 1458] (fol. 120b). On the copyist, see Sakhāwī, Ḍawʼ, vol. 5, p. 54-55 (no. 202) and GAL, SII, 915.|Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.

note: Ms. codex.|Title from title page (fol. 2a).|17 lines per page. Written in medium small naskh in black ink with use of red for headings and overlining. Red dot text-stops. physical_description: Extent: i, 209, i leaves: paper ; 255 x 170 (180 x 115) mm. bound to 255 x 175 mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title from title page (fol. 1a).|Incipit: الحمد لله ذى العزّة و [---] والرحمة والافضال والصلاة على رسوله ... قال الشيخ الامام علآ ال[---] النظر ابو بكر محمد بن احمد السمرقندى متّعه الله من علمه ان [---] ول الفقه والاحكام فرع لعلم اصول الكلام|21 lines per page. Written in medium large naskh in black ink faded to brown, with some use of red. Thick cream paper with laid and chain lines visible. Quinions. Marginal annotations by several hands. Two spine labels with inscriptions reading respectively "Kitāb Mīzān al-uṣūl fī natāʼij al-ʻuqūl" in Arabic script and "10[3]" in Western and Arabic numerals. The two first leaves are damaged with loss of text. Ink faded with some loss of text due to humidity damage up to fol. 69 and on last folios.|Collation: Paper, fol. i, 209, i ; i (later added free endpaper), 110 (-1, before fol. 1) 2-2110, i (later added free endpaper) ; the quires are numbered using Arabic ordinals in the form "thānī" (see fol. 10a) ; signs to mark the middle of the quire (see fol. 15a) ; foliation in black ink using Arabic numerals (note the characteristic 5).|Copy completed on Yawm al-Khamīs middle of Dhū al-Qaʻdah 624 [Oct. 26, 1227] by ʻAbd al-Qāhir ibn Aḥmad [ibn] Muḥammad ibn al-Ḥasan ibn al-Ṭabīb al-Ḥanafī (colophon, fol. 209a). The text has been collated on a copy in the hand of Raḍī al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad al-Ṭūsānī(?) al-...(?), known as al-Muḥīṭ, in the first ten days of Dhū al-Ḥijjah 624 [Nov. 1227] (collation statement on the margin of the colophon, fol. 209a).|Several ownership statements and seal in red ink reading "British Museum" on fol. 1a and 209b. Acquired from Mūrad Bey Bārūdī, Beirut, 1925.

Catchwords on the verso of fol. 1-4 and 10 of each quire. Traces of what might be indications for the binding on some folios (see fol. 39b, 60b, 69b, cut off by the trimming of the pages)|Copied by ʻUmar ibn Aḥmad ibn Maḥallī al-ʻAdhabī al-[...] bi-ṣadr al-Masjid al-Aqṣá on 18 Rajab 737.|Ownership statement on fol. 1a. physical_description: Extent: 418 leaves: paper ; 230 x 160 (140 x 90) mm. bound to 230 x 160 mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title from title page (fol. 3a).|21 lines per page. Written in medium small naskh with elements of taʻlīq in black ink with use of red for overlining and for the word "qawluh" (spaces for the latter left blank on some leaves). Thin light biscuit paper with large laid lines and pulp visible. Fol. 416b-418b: Blank. Fol. 1 and 417-418 are a later added flyleaves on European paper with watermark, with inscriptions on fol. 1a.|Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on the pastedown of the upper cover: "Ḥāʼ 213/2". Inscription in red pencil in Arabic script on fol. 1a: "Uṣūl 1/78".|Copy completed on 1 Jumādá al-Ākhar 988 [July 14, 1580] (colophon, fol. 416a).|Four ownership statements on fol. 3a, in the name of Muḥammad ibn al-Walī, dated 26 Dhū al-Ḥijjah 1008 (or 1006?) [July 1600 or 1598]; of ...?, dated 1051 H. [1641 or 2] ; of Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad ibn Isḥāq ; of Aḥmad Najīb, dated 20 [Shawwā]l 1279 [April 1863]. Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.

physical_description: Extent: v + 465 leaves: paper ; 208 x 142 (145 x 75) mm. bound to 215 x 150 mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title supplied by cataloger.|19 lines per page. Written in medium small taʻlīq in black ink with use of red for "qawluh". European paper with watermark. Illuminated headpiece (ʻunwān) in gold, blue and white on fol. 1b. The text is framed within one red line (gold and black on fol. 1b-2a). Marginal annotations by several hands. Fol. 463-465: Blank. On fol. ii-iv: Table of contents in a grid in red ink. Several inscriptions on fol. 1a, including Kabīkaj.|Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on the upper cover: "Uṣūl 27(?)". Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on the pastedown of the upper cover: "Ḥāʼ 1069".|Copy completed in the beginning of Jumādá al-Ākhirah 995 [May 1587] (colophon, fol. 462b).|Several ownership statements, some with seal, on fol. 1a, in the name of ʻAbd al-Laṭīf ibn ibrāhīm Aqshahrī, dated 1110 H. [1698 or 9] ; Miftāḥ al-Dīn ibn Husām al-Dīn al-Bukhārī, with seal dated 1247 H. [1831 or 2] ; Ḥusayn ibn Bayram(?), dated 1274 [1857 or 8], with mention of the price ; Aḥmad Najīb ibn Aḥmad Ṭāhir, dated Jumādá al-Ākhirah 1286 [Sept.-Oct., 1869]. Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.

physical_description: Extent: 289 leaves: paper ; 267 x 182 (190 x 128) mm. bound to 267 x 185 mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title from title page (fol. 4a). Written in medium small naskh in black ink with use of red ; yāʾ for alif maqṣūrah. Light cream paper; glossy; with a few lines visible. Marginal annotations. Table of abbreviations in a grid in red ink on fol. 3b-4a, apparently written by the same hand as the main text. Several inscriptions in later hands on fol. 1a-3a, including Kabīkaj, ownership statements, and table of contents. Title on tail of text block. Stained with water.|Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on the upper cover: "Ḥ 117". Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on the pastedown of the upper cover: "Ḥ 992".|Origin: According to colophon, copy completed 4 Jumādá al-Ūlá 935 [Jan. 14, 1529] (fol. 289b).|Several ownership statements on fol. 1a, some with impression of a seal, including one in the name of Aḥmad ibn ʻAbd al-Ḥalīm, qāḍī bi-Madīnat ---? (partly erased). Several ownership statements on fol. 5a, in the name of al-Shaykh ʻAbd Allāh al-Muftī (with seal); ʻAbd al-Wahhāb al-Qāḍī, dated 1104 H.; Muḥammad Makkī; al-Shaykh Muḥammad al-Muftī bi-...?, dated 1168 H.; Aḥmad Najīb ibn Aḥmad, dated 1282 H. physical_description: Extent: 158 leaves : paper ; 151 x 102 (115 x 75) mm. bound to 151 x 112 mm.
note: Ms. composite codex.|Title from fol. 1a.|Most of the texts are written in medium small to small naskh in black ink, with some use of red. Several are in same hand, or are in similar style, with about 18 lines per page on avarage. Texts 1-11 on unglazed European paper. Text no. 12 differs the most from the rest: it is written in very small elegant nastaʻlīq, is on different paper (glazed European) and appears to be of a later date than most of the rest of the ms. Similarly, text no. 13 is on different paper (dark cream glazed European) and appears to be the oldest section of the ms.|Originally acquired by Robert Garrett from Abraham Shalom Yahuda ; 1942.

author_as_recorded_agr: محلي، جلال الدين محمد بن احمد
physical_description: Extent: 332 leaves: paper ; 182 x 133 (130 x 100) mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title from illuminated title page (fol. 1a). The name of the author appears on fol. 1a and in the colophon, fol. 332b.|Physical description: 25 lines per page. Written in small naskh in black ink with use of red. Simply illuminated title page (ʻunwān) on fol. 1a. Thick light cream paper with pulp, and laid and chain lines visible. The quires (mainly quinions with a few quaternions) are numbered using Arabic numerals (see "2" on fol. 11a). Catchword on the verso of each leaf. The first leaf is damaged. Kabīkaj on fol. 1a. Title on the tail of the text block (hardly legible).|The title page has a rectangular panel on its upper part, with the title written in gold outlined in black in a cloud cartouche left blank over a ground hatched in red, inscribed in a rectangular frame of one single black line. This is inscribed in a frame consisting of two gold lines outlined in black. Underneath the rectangular panel is a roundel with a similar decoration, except for the inscription (name of the author) here written in black. Both the rectangular panel and the roundel are outlined in a now almost totally faded blue line with radiating flecks.|Origin: Copied for himself by Ḥasan ibn ʻAlī ibn Ḥasan al-Qāhirī Ibn ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad al-Shabshīrī, on Tuesday 11 Shaʻbān 887 [Sept. 24, 1482] (colophon, fol. 332b). At the end of the colophon, the copyist adds the text of an ijāzah written by the author for Zayn al-Dīn Abū al-Khayr Muḥammad al-Māwardī, dated 6 Shaʻbān 860 [July 10, 1456].|Several ownership statements on fol. 1a, some obliterated, one in the name of Muḥammad ibn Yaḥyá ibn [---] al-Dasūqī, dated Dhū al-Ḥijjah 1176 [July 1763], with seal. Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.

physical_description: Extent: 109 leaves : paper ; 180 x 137 (126 x 97) mm. bound to 185 x 153 mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title from title page (fol. 1a).|The title also appears in the beginning of the text (fol. 1b, l. 14), and the name of the author in the colophon (fol. 107b).|17 long lines per page. Written in black ink with some use of red for headings and for the punctuation in the passages in rhymed prose (see fol. 1b, 14a). Light cream paper with horizontal laid lines visible. Vertical chain lines visible on some leaves. Some passages have been crossed out (see fol. 54b, 76b-77a). Very few notes in the margin (see fol. 49b). Several inscriptions on fol. 109b. Inscription "503" on the upper cover (corresponding to Brill's catalogue). Modern foliation in pencil using Western numerals.|Collation: Paper ; fol. 109 ; 18210 (+1, f. 9) 310 4-1110 ; quires numbered using Arabic ordinals (starts on fol. 60a, "sābiʻah" ; traces on fol. 40a, partly cut off) ; catchword on the verso of each leaf.|Autograph, Jerusalem ("al-Quds al-sharīf") on 29 Jumādá al-Ākhirah 800 H. [March 1398] (colophon, fol. 107b).|Several ownership statements on fol. 1a, the earliest dated legible reading Dhū al-Ḥijjah 911 H. [April-May 1506]. Reading statement on fol. 108b-109a, in the name of Muḥammad ibn ʻAbd Allāh al-Ḥanafī [...] al-Dayrī, mentioning the author as still living. Reading statements on fol. 107b-108a (signed ʻAlī ibn al-Ḥasan from Sarmīn) and on fol. 109a (signed al-Mamlūk ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn Muḥammad ibn Ismaʻīl ibn al-Qalqashandī). Acquired from Brill, Leyden, 1900, from the books of Amīn ibn al-Ḥasan al-Ḥulwānī al-Madanī al-Ḥanafī (Medina).

physical_description: Extent: 355 leaves : paper ; 238 x 175 (160 x 105) mm. bound to 241 x 180 mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title from colophon (fol. 354a).|Physical description: 21 lines per page. Written in small round naskh in black ink with use of red. Change in script after fol. 165. On some leaves of the first script, the last letters of a word at the end of a line are written on the margin (see for example fol. 70a). Fol. 1 apparently consists of two leaves pasted on one another. Inscriptions and short texts on fol. 354b-355a. Chiefly quaternions ; catchword on the verso of each leaf. Title on the fore-edge of the text block (horizontal), reading: "Fa-inna al-Dhikrá intafaʻa al-muʼminīn".|Origin: According to colophon, copy completed on Monday in Rabīʻ al-Ākhar 1017 (fol. 354a, with seal reading: "Muḥammad Taqī Ghulām ʻAlī").|Several ownership statements and impressions of seals on fol. 1a and 354a, including one in the name of Ibn Muḥammad Riḍá Muḥammad Taqī al-Rāzī, dated Dār al-Ṣalṭanah Iṣfahān, 1048 H. ; and one in Persian in the name of Zayn al-Dīn Jaʻfar Zāhidī, dated 1375 H.

author_as_recorded: ʻĀmilī, Bahāʼ al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn Ḥusayn, 1547-1621
author_as_recorded_agr: عاملي، بهاء الدين محمد بن حسين
physical_description: Extent: 222 leaves : paper ; 255 x 190 mm. bound to 256 x 195 mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title supplied by cataloger.|Physical description: 23 lines per page. Written in small to medium small naskh in black ink with use of red. Thin dark cream to light brown paper, glossy, with pulp and laid lines visible. Marginal annotations. Several inscriptions in Arabic and in Persian on fol. 1a, including a note describing the contents of the volume. Several short excerpts on fol. 6b-7a. Table of contents of the Ḥabl al-matīn on fol. 1b-2a. Table of contents of the Mashriq al-Shamsayn on fol. 151b-152a. Collation statement in a tughrah-like shape on fol. 83b. Mainly quaternions; catchword on the verso of each leaf.|Inscription in Arabic numerals on a handmade label pasted on the upper cover: "51". Inscription in Arabic numerals in red pencil on fol. 7a: "6998" ; on fol. 152b: "3152".|Origin: According to colophon, Text 1 copied by Jaʻfar ibn Muḥammad Bāqir al-Kāshānī on Thursday 14(?) Dhū al-Ḥijjah 1076 [June 17, 1666] (fol. 5a). Text 2 copied by Muḥammad Naṣīr Ibn ʻAbd al-Qādir, and completed in Shawwāl 1075 [1665] (fol. 83b and 150b, where the name reads: "Ibn ʻAbd al-Qādir Muḥammad Naṣīr"). This text was collated by Jaʻfar ibn Muḥammad Bāqir (collation statement dated 15 Shawwāl 1077 [April 10, 1667], with seal, fol. 150b).|From the Kitābkhānah-i Majd al-Dīn, no. 654 (stamp on fol. 3a). On fol. 7a: Ownership statement dated 1199 H. with impression of a seal (name erased; same seal on fol. 1a) ; ownership statement dated Friday 11 Dhū al-Qaʻdah 1247 in the name of Ibn ʻAbd al-ʻAzīz Muḥammad Rasūl al-Qāsānī, with price in dīnār tabrīzī. Ownership statement in the name of Baḥr al-ʻulūm Muḥammad Bāqir al-Ḥusaynī, dated 1250 H. on fol. 221b.

On second flyleaf, owner's note and stamp of Muḥammad Jaʻfar (different handwriting and stamp from that on first flyleaf). Two smudged stamps on third flyleaf. Owner's stamp on leaf 13b. Partially smudged owner's stamp on leaf 301b.

Covers and envelope flap have blind stamped double fillet border. Centers of covers have blind stamped mandorlas with tulip designs at top and bottom, all with raised floral motif. Envelope flap has oval stamped design at center. Fore edge flap has single fillet border. Top corner of fore edge and back cover slightly charred.|Dep. no. 9560. Gift of Bruce Willsie (Princeton Class of 1988).

author_as_recorded_agr: ابن العراقي، احمد بن عبد الرحيم
note: Ms. codex.|Title from title page of vol. 1 (fol. 1a).|Physical description: 29 lines per page. Written in medium small naskh in black ink with use of red for headings, re-inking, entries, and verse marks. Yāʾ for alif maqṣūrah ; final yāʾ dotted. Dark cream paper, glossy, hardly translucid, with laid and chain lines visible ; frame-ruled. Important marginal annotation. Stained with water; first leaf of vol. 2 damaged and poorly repaired (most of text still legible).|Chiefly quinions. Catchword on the verso of each leaf ; the quires in vol. 2 are numbered using Arabic numerals.|Origin: According to colophon, copy of vol. 1 completed on Monday, 8 Dhū al-Qaʻdah 872 [May 30, 1468] (fol. 208b). Vol. 2 completed on Saturday(?) 9 Rabīʻ al-Awwal 875 [Sept. 5, 1470] (fol. 194b). Copied for himself by ʻAlī ibn Ḥusayn al-Munhilī(?) al-Shāfiʻī (vol. 1, fol. 208b). The colophon of vol. 2 gives details on the exemplar. On the copyist, see Sakhāwī, al-Ḍawʾ al-lāmiʻ, 5/216: ʻAlī ibn Ḥusayn Nūr al-Dīn al-Munhilī al-Azharī al-Shāfiʻī, d. Rabīʻ I 891.|Waqf statement in the name of Amīr Maḥmūd ibn Amīr Sayf al-Dīn al-JRDqīlī (الجردقيلى; vol. 1, fol. 1a). Four ownership statements on vol. 1, fol. 1a, in the name of ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn al-shaykh ʻAlī al-Baṭnāwī al-ʻUlwānī ; of ʻUthmān ---?, 981 H. ; of Ṣāliḥ ibn Halāl, 1053 H.; the fourth obliterated. Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.

note: Ms. codex.|Title from rubric on fol. 1b.|Physical description: 18 lines per page. Written in medium large naskh, in black ink with use of red and blue for headings and re-inking; marks consisting of three red or blue dots at beginning, centre, and end of each line; yāʼ for alif maqṣūrah. European paper; glossy; frame-ruled. Occasional marginal annotation. Several inscriptions on fol. 1a, including ownership statements and the copy of a letter from Medina ("ṣūrat maktūb warada min al-Madīnah al-munawwarah min baʻḍ al-fuḍalāʼ wa-li-baʻḍ al-ahsrāf"). Fol. 149: Blank. Stained with water ; blue and red ink washed off on some leaves; some insect damage on lower edge.|Collation: Paper, fol. 149 ; 1-1410 158 (+1 at end of quire) ; catchword on the verso of each leaf.|Origin: According to colophon, copy completed on Yawm al-Sabt 17 Shawwāl 1030 [Sept. 4, 1621] (fol. 147b).|Several ownership statements on fol. 1a, including one in the name of al-Sayyid Muḥammad Jaʻfar Ibn al-Sayyid Muḥammad Ibn al-Sayyid ʻAlī Burhān al-Dīn al-Dasūqī al-Shāfiʻī al-Biqāʻī. Acquired from the books of Murād Bey al-Bārūdī (Beirut), 1925.

physical_description: Extent: 2 v. (ii, 362, ii + ii, 292, ii) leaves : paper ; 345 x 220 (220 x 125) mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title from vol. 1, fol. 3a.|Physical description: Both volumes are written in medium large taʻlīq in black ink with use of red, green, yellow, and blue. European paper with watermark ; some leaves dyed in blue. Annotations on the margins, between the lines and on slips of paper placed between the original leaves.|Vol. 1: Title page (fol. 3a in the modern foliation) apparently later addition. The title is written in black ink on a ground of red dots, with use of red and dark yellow for filling of some letters. Several inscriptions on fol. 3b-4a, mainly short excerpts from various texts. Short prayer praising the Prophet Muḥammad on fol. 2a. Short text on purification (ṭahārah) on fol. 1b. Modern foliation in pencil (counts a fly-leaf as fol. 1).|Vol. 2: Fol. 290a-291a: Blank. Short excerpts from several texts on fol. 291b and 292b. Title written in black on a green and red ground (fol. 1a).|Some of the slips of paper placed between the leaves are letters, now shelved separately.|Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on the upper cover: "387-388". Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on the pastedown of upper cover: "546/2 ḥāʼ", on both volumes.|Origin: Copy of vol. 1 completed in 1219 H. (colophon, fol. 361a).|Vol. 1 : From the books of Shaʻbān ibn Muḥammad ʻAlī al-QRdī al-Buhnudī(?) (ownership statement on the decorated title page ; on al-Buhnudī, see M. Gammer, Muslim Resistance to the Tsar (1994), p. 60). Given by KHRī Ibrāhīm to Dāniyāl Sulṭān (inscription dated 1271 H. [1854 or 5] on fol. 3a). Ownership statement on the lower left corner of fol. 4a (hardly legible). Vol. 2 : From the books of ʻUmar ibn Ibrāhīm (ownership statement on the decorated title page). From the books of Dāniyāl, who bought it from Ḥājj ʻUthmān ibn Ḥājj Mūsá al-Daghistānī (inscription dated 1271 H. on fol. 1a). From the books of Ghāzzī Muḥammad Efendi (ownership statement dated 1289 H. on fol. 1a). Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.

subject_as_recorded: Ibn al-ḥājib, ʻUthmān ibn ʻUmar, 1175-1249. Mukhtaṣar al-Muntahá|Islamic law--Interpretation and construction--Early works to 1800|Malikites--Early works to 1800
author_as_recorded: Kirmānī, Muḥammad ibn Yūsuf, 1317 or 1318-1384 or 1385
note: ff. 235. 316 x 167; 228 x 115 mm. 35 lin. Rabīʻ II, 1089.|The anon. author, a pupil of al-Ījī, states in the preface that he began his study of uṣūl al-fiqh after having composed his al-Kawāshif al-Burhānīyah fī sharḥ al-Mawāqif al-sulṭānīyah, a commentary on his master ʼs al-Mawāqif; he completed the present commentary on Mukhtaṣar al-Muntahá, entitled al-Nuqūd wa-al-rudūd (the title appears in the preface, fol. 2a, lin. 13) in Shawwāl 762 in Baghdād (the date in the colophon). According to Brockelmann, GAL, S I, 538 (commentary 13)and Flügelʼs ed. of ḥājjī Khalīfah, Kashf al-ẓunūn, (VI, 173) the author is Muḥammad ibn Yūsuf al-Kirmānī, d. 786/1384, but in Yaltkayaʼs ed. of ḥājjī Khalīfah, Kashf al-ẓunūn, (col. 1854), Ibn ḥajar, al-Durar al-kāminah, IV, 250 ult., and the mss. Ṭalas, al-Kashshāf, no. 1480 and Mashhad, uṣūl nos. 37-38 (with title al-Rudūd wa-al-nuqūd -- listed as a different commentary in Brockelmann, GAL, S I, 538, commentary 14) this work is attributed to Akmal al-Dīn al-Bābartī (d. in the same year as al-Kirmānī); in view of the fact that the present commentary was composed in Baghdad, and that the commentator refers to al-Ījī as to his teacher, al-Kirmānī (a pupil of al-Ījī: Ibn ḥajar, al-Durar al-kāminah, IV, 311) is in all probability the author.|Incip.: ... ىا مفىض الخىرات وىا منزل البرکات ... الحمد لله الذى افاض على العالمىن انواع عواطف خىرات المعارف

physical_description: Extent: i, 94, i leaves: paper ; 280 x 170 (215 x 135) mm. bound to 290 x 190 mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title supplied by cataloger.|35 lines per page. Written in thick medium small casual naskh with elements of taʻlīq in black ink with use of red for commented text. Some lines are crossed out (see fol. 15a, first three lines). Soft paper with laid lines visible. Fol. 1-2 and 92-93: European paper with watermark. Ḥāshiyah on the margins. Several inscriptions on fol. 1a and 2b, 91a-b, and 92b, in Arabic, Ottoman Turkish and Persian. Talisman with short inscription in Arabic on fol. 93a. One page of modern paper with short text pasted between fol. 74 and 75. Edges of pages damaged. Modern foliation in pencil using Western numerals (omits a folio between fol. 2 and 3).|Copy completed on 15 Muḥarram 825 [Jan. 9, 1422] (colophon, fol. 91a).|Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on the upper cover: "Uṣūl 49". Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on the pastedown of the upper cover: "Ḥāʼ 1316".|Undated ownership statements on fol. 3a. Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.

physical_description: Extent: ii, 304, ii leaves : paper ; 270 x 190 (190 x 130) mm. bound to 275 x 200 mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title supplied by cataloger, according to Mach. R. Yahuda.|Physical description: 19 lines per page. Written in medium large taʻlīq in black ink with use of red to overline the commented text. Scarce use of yellow as background of headings. Rough biscuit paper with thick laid lines and fibers visible ; fibers on the surface. Some leaves are not trimmed. Marginal annotations. A few slips of paper with annotations are placed between the original folios. Several short excerpts of various texts on fol. 1a and 304b.|Collation: Paper, fol. ii, 304, ii ; i (free endpaper; marbled recto) i (fly-leaf; European paper with watermark) + 110 (-2 at the beginning of quire) 2-310 412 5-1110 1210 (-1 at the beginning of quire, between fol. 110 and 111; fol. wanting according to the catchword on fol. 110b) 1312 14-3010 314 + i (fly-leaf; European paper with watermark) i (free endpaper; marbled verso) ; catchword on the verso of each leaf.|Inscription by a modern hand in red ink on fol. 1a: "Juzʾ fī al-fiqh al-Shāfiʻī lam aqif ʻalá ismahu".|Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on the upper cover: "Thānī 430". Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on the pastedown of upper cover: "Ḥāʾ 1394".|Origin: Copy completed in Ṣafar 1070 [Oct.-Nov. 1659] by Layzan(?) ibn Shaʻbān from Qariyat ʻSLī in the madrasah of Mawlānā ... Sayf al-Millah wa-al-Dīn Jamāl al-Islām Sayyid al-fuqahāʾ ... Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad from Qariyat MWRKHī fī madrasah(?) BQLKHī. The copyist adds that he finished this copy while traveling from Qariyat BQLKHī to Qariyat HRDRKHī, and that he was born in 104?4 H. (colophon, fol. 304a ; portions of the colophon are outlined by a circle in black and red).|Apparently from the group of manuscripts from the entourage of Imām Shamīl (see Mach, R. Yahuda). Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.

physical_description: Extent: 535 leaves : paper ; 349 x 195 (252 x 124) mm bound to 354 x 202 mm
note: Ms. codex.|Title from leaf 1b.|Physical description: 26 lines per page; written in neat naskh in black on cream glazed, laid Arabic paper. On leaf 1b, illuminated ʻunwān in gold and color, partially torn away; juzʼ 6 heading in white set within a gold lozenge. Remaining juzʼ headings in large, red thuluth set within a box with gold, orange, and blue border. Text framed in blue and gold. Rubrication and catchwords; not all spaces left for rubrication are filled in. Juzʼ 7 labeled as such in heading, but stated to be juzʼ 8 in colophon on leaf 284b. Extensive repairs to first leaf; last leaf detached. Some damp staining and a few paper repairs.|Origin: According to Mach, likely 17th century.|On leaf 1a are notes dated 1151 H and 1162 H. Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.

note: Ms. codex.|Title from colophon (fol. 81a).|Physical description: 23 lines per page. Written in medium small naskh in black ink with use of red for entries (space left blank in the middle of the copy). Dark cream paper, glossy, with laid and chain lines visible, the latter in groups of three. Important ḥāshiyah on the beginning of the text. Short excerpts and inscriptions in black and red ink on fol. 1a and 81b-82a, including a quotation of the entry on the book and its author from Kātib Çelebi (fol. 81b). Modern purple pastedown and free endpaper, half-covering a previous pastedown of the upper cover, with table of contents. Foliation in black ink using Arabic numerals. Before the original text-block are two leaves, the free endpaper in purple paper and an added fly-leaf on European paper, with title written by a modern hand.|Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on the upper cover: "Uṣūl 31". Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on the pastedown of the upper cover: "Ḥ 64".|Origin: According to colophon, copy completed on the night of Sunday, 1 ("ghurrah) Jumādá al-Ūlá 760 [March 31, 1359], by ʻUthmān ibn Ṭawrah Faqīh ibn al-Ḥājāt(?) (fol. 81a).|Impression of a seal on fol. 1a, 80b and 81a. Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.

subject_as_recorded: Muḥaqqiq al-Ḥillī, Jaʻfar ibn al-Ḥasan, 1205 or 1206-1277. Sharāʼiʻ al-Islām|Islamic law--History--16th century--Sources|Shīʻah--History--16th century--Sources|Manuscripts, Arabic--New Jersey--Princeton
author_as_recorded: ʻĀmilī, Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī, 1539 or 1540-1600
author_as_recorded_agr: عاملي، محمد بن علي
physical_description: Extent: 205 leaves : paper ; 302 x 175 (220 x 110) mm. bound to 302 x 183 mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title from colophon (fol. 198b in the modern foliation).|Physical description: 31 lines per page. Written in medium small naskh in black ink with use of red for headings and entries The text is framed within two lines in red (outlined in blue in the first half of the copy). Thin dark cream to biscuit paper, glossy, with laid lines visible. Marginal annotations (collation notes and glosses). Several inscriptions on fol. 1a and 2a, including ownership statements, and a note mentioning a price. Title on tail of text block and on fore-edge (hardly legible). Partial foliation in pencil, starting with "2" on fol. 6 (the second leaf of the main text). First leaves loose.|Inscription "49" in Arabic numerals and Western numerals on fol. 1a.|Origin: According to colophon, copied by Nāṣir ibn ʻAlī ibn Ibrāhīm ibn Khwān al-Darāzī al-Baḥrānī, Thursday 22 Muḥarram 1086 [April 18, 1675] (fol. 198b).|Several ownership statements on fol. 1a and 2a, including one in the name of ʻAbd Allāh ibn ʻAlī ibn Aḥmad ibn Sulaymān (with impression of a seal dated 13--?; repeated on fol. 4a), and one dated Shīrāzī 1190 H. Impression of a small seal on fol. 1b.

Fol. 55 is blank, except one line ; lower part of fol. 56 wanting.|Inscription in Arabic numerals on a label pasted on the upper cover: "31" (repeated in Western and Arabic numerals on fol. 1a).|Origin: According to colophon, copied by Muḥammad Salīm ibn Murtaḍá Qulī Afshār, who completed his work (taswīd) on Thursday 12 Jumādá al-Thānī 1090 [July 1679] (fol. 132b).

note: Ms. gatherings.|Physical description: 7 lines per page; written in large naskhi script in black on daluang paper.
